Description: Essentially an entirely non-solid func_wall. If it has toggleable textures, they will toggle when the entity is triggered.

KeyDescriptions.keyDescription: Set name of {{ entname }}. Can't be triggered. Can be kill-targeted.
Apply a style to texlights of this brush (texlights are textures specified in [info_texlights](../info_texlights). This is not required when using [light_surface](../light_surface).

keyChoices.choiceDescription: Allow your texlights to be switchable. To use it, create a light entity with the same name as this brush entity. Turning the light on and off will now turn the texlights on and off, too.

KeyDescriptions.keyDescription: It's used to change the 'contents' of this brush.

keyChoices.choiceDescription: Default, empty content. Nothing special happens when walking through {{ entname }}.
If set, the func_illusionary will use its angles (Pitch Yaw Roll). This requires origin brush tied to it, otherwise it will pick world origin.

KeyDescriptions.keyDescription: Sets the minimum light level. Set this value if entity is too dark on compiled map. Also useful for things like computer screens or holograms. Default is 0, max 1.

Notes: Even if non-solid, this entity still adds clipnodes. Set "ZHLT Disable Clipping" to 'Always non-solid' to prevent that or add zhlt_noclip key with value of 1. Alternatively, use SKIP texture instead of NULL on faces that have the texture on the entity.
